Hey! man, this thing hasn't seen an update in about a year.  i don't really have much to write at this moment.  i visited my sister in center city today and we did some christmas shopping.  we also went to this place near her apartment to get this poster matted and framed for my brother.  the cool thing about this place is that you do all the work yourself. obviously they have people there showing you what to do, but you actually get to do it.  so my sister and i matted and framed this poster for him. it was pretty cool.  although, alyssa did get a little testy when we got to the one step and she couldn't get the thing lined up right to cut it...then she yelled at me for trying to help. ok, so she didn't really yell, but she did get testy. then she was all anal about there being the most miniscule piece of dust being on the glass or on the poster.  it was kind of funny actually..so i was of course making fun of her.  after that we got something to eat and then went shopping in center city.  it was fun, quite cold, but fun.
    
i have to finish my xmas shopping tomorrow. blah. i think i also have to take my little bro shopping cause no one has done that yet and i'm pretty much the only one around who can.  hopefully i can do that early tomorrow night and get it out of the way...cause i really don't want to be shopping anytime this weekend.  not much else is going on here.  i want to get my grades...but then again i don't.  they'll probably come in the mail right before the new year.  it's like some cruel joke.  they send your grades and then they print a little note on the bottom telling you to have a happy holiday.  it just make you feel so much better.  anyway, i'm tired of writing, so i'm going to go watch some tv. mmmm...tv.  ok, bye.

Tonight Colleen told me something that got me thinking about my roommate.  Last night, this kid Chris (he lives down the hall) came into her room looking for some food.  Susie and Chris went to high school together and Susie always made it seem like they were friends.  She didn't go to a big school, so we always assumed they probably were.  Well, Chris told Colleen that he was never really friends with Susie and he thought that most of her friends were pretty dumb (not as in stupid dumb, but kind of ridiculous dumb maybe).  He didn't ever want to be friends with them and that's why he hasn't really made an effort to be friends with Susie this year even though he lives down the hall because he associates her with those people from high school.  I don't know, it just made me think of how different Susie and I are sometimes.  I mean, we get along really well and we do have fun together, which is why I am planning on living with her again next year.  I guess we just had very different high school experiences and sometimes its really hard for me to understand why she acts the way she does and says the things she says.  From my experience, her life is filled with drama,drama that from my perspective, isn't drama at all.  She makes a big deal out of things that really aren't that big a deal, at least not to me and for the most part not for colleen either.  Its hard to explain.  I don't want to say that I am more mature than she is, but I think the fact that I went to a huge high school helped me put things into persepctive a bit better.  I mean, sometimes I compare the way Colleen and I think to the way Susie thinks and it is a lot different.  Colleen and I both went to large high schools, where as Susie went to a school where every one knew every one else and she can name every one in her graduating class.  I think it has had an effect on the way she reacts to things in college.

This is going to seem a little odd, but for instance, Colleen and I sometimes can't understand the things that Susie has on her wall.  She puts some weird stuff on there.  I mean, she has some pictures of friends, but she also has pictures of what appear to be patterns that she made out of beads sitting on a table.  She always complains and gets depressed that she doesn't have a boyfriend, yet she makes collages that are all about love and soulmates and stuff.  When she talks to her friends on the phone or online, there is always some huge drama going on and a lot of times she goes out in the hall and talks for hours.  When she tells me what is going on...I always look at her kind of like "oh...that's all?".  One of the biggest things that confuses me and I don't know how to talk to her about it, is her relationships with guys.  From what Susie has told me, she didn't really have many male friends in high school.  So once a guy sort of shows interest in her, even if it is just as a friendship relationship, she kind of latches on and doesn't let go for long periods of time....long periods. She has a friend Matt back home who goes to school in Georgia.  He had a girlfriend, but for some reason, although he and Susie are good friends, she was convinced that he had feelings for her.  She would write about how she loved him in her profile and stuff and call him all the time.  Then she would get really mad and upset when he didn't call her back or if he didn't talk to her online.  Ever since I have met her, all the guys she has developed fairly decent relationships with, she has assumed that there is an element of romance there and it is nearely impossible to convince her there isn't.  I don't know, I don't want to make it sound like she is an idiot, its just hard sometimes because I don't know how to tell her what I am thinking about a situation without hurting her feelings.  For awhile, she was convinced that she was going to have a relationships with one of colleen's friends who is a drummer in a punk band.  Colleen kept trying to tell her that he wasn't interested and that perhaps she wasn't his type (he really wasn't...at all)  For months we tried to convince her of this, but she just couldn't understand.  In the meantime, colleen had to try to avoid interactions with him and had to try to keep the band's shows a secret because she didn't want Susie to come and get all wrapped up in the relationship she thought was going to happen.  She couldn't have him come visit because she was afraid Susie would be hanging all over him all night and try to sleep with him.  The fact of the matter was that he had a girlfriend and told colleen that he was not interested in Susie at all.  It took her months to get over that, but now she is having the same trouble with her friend matt.  I don't know, I think maybe its easier for colleen and i to really see whats going on because we have had more interactions with people and more interactions with different people.  It's hard for me to understand how Susie can't see whats really going on.  And I'll admit, sometimes it bothers me.

Sometimes i just want to sit and talk with her and tell her that life doesn't have to be filled with such insignificant drama and that there is a difference between a friendship and a relationship.  Don't get me wrong, I like Susie and I like being her roommate and friend, I just can't understand why she acts that way she does sometimes and how she thinks the way she does.  It bothers me when she walks around the room totally pissed off, not talking to anyone, putting up grumpy away messages and won't talk to me about what's going on.  And then when she finally does, I find out she is mad because Matt told that she didn't need to respond to an apology letter her friend wrote her over winter break for not inviting her to the beach 2 summers ago.  I don't know, it all seems so ridiculous to me and sometimes I just feel like I can't relate to that.  

Anyway, I just needed to vent a little bit of my thinking somewhere.  Maybe I'll talk to Susie sometime about all this. Of course maybe its really none of my business.  Anyway, I gotta go do some more work now.  Perhaps I shall return.  LAter dudes.

So yeah...i realized I haven't written in here in a way long time.  But then shannon wanted to start an account, and you have to pay unless someone invites you, so i invited her. I am getting fit monday, wednesday, and friday at 10 and I have a study of jazz class which is pretty cool.  My other two classes are actually really hard, but I think I'll survive.

I think I am going to try (key word:try) to write in this more often.  It would take me forever to play catch up, so I am just going to write what happened today.  I had a nice workout this morning, and then I went to lunch with some ho's (susie and shannon). I was supposed to have my study of jazz class, but my prof. was out so it was cancelled.  So I came back to my room and susie and I watched a lifetime movie.  It was a good one.  Then I sat around and copied music off the network.  Then I went to dinner with some ho's (susie, colleen, and shannon).  Shannon had to leave and she managed to leave right as her "boy" was coming in.  She thinks this kid is a total dork, but he has nice hair and she has this weird crush on him.  Of course, she doesn't know his name or anything, but...eh...it doesn't matter.  We saw him sign up at the frat rush table....so maybe he is trying to un-dorkify himself, however, it could result in him becoming a total jack ass.  

We went to the mall tonight.  It was nothing really exciting, since the mall closes at 9.  I didn't find the shirt I was looking for, but oh well.  Right now we are looking for something else to do. As you can tell, we live the wild life here.  But actually,we have a lot of fun so I'm not complaining.  

Alright, that's enough for now.  I think I am going to do something else.  Later dudes.

bad because my grandparents have given them so much money over the years.  they freakin' bought their house for them...and now look at them....they are white trash and not doing a damn thing with themselves.  i don't know how my cousin thinks she is going to survive with a 9th grade education and a boyfriend who installs cable.  when my grandfather was alive, he used to get angry at my aunt and try to make her see all the bad decisions she was making, but now that he is gone, my grandmother is too afraid and she just keeps her mouth shut.  i mean, my aunt and uncle are on the verge of     anyway, that is what i'm thinking about right now.  work was boring today...but i made it through.  maybe we'll all get together and hang out tonight...that would be stellar.  anyway...today was not too shabby.  i talked to colleen online.  we had a good talk.  i miss that girl...but i'll be seing her soon!! yo.  well, i know i haven't written in here in a long time, so here it goes. not much has been going on except work....its boring as all hell...but i get $10 an hour so no complaints here (actually i complain every day, but i always go anyway).  Susis came to visit on friday and she left yesterday...we had a blast...and i finally made it to the jersey shore!!!!!  it was everything i ever dreamed....exceot for the extreme sunburn that has crippled me.  it really was a lot of fun though...now i want to go back.  anyway, the firday night that susie got here we pretty much just hung out...mike joined us.  it was fun, but we were driving around and i sort of got upset.  i didn't want to get upset while susie was in the car, so i eventually had to take him home.  susie decided to stay at my house and just get ready for bed. so i had pretty much gotten over it, but mike was angry about something. so i asked him what was wrong and for some reason (i couldn't really get him to explain it) he was upset because i had been so excited about susie coming and i guess he felt like i was ignoring him or something like that, but i'm really not sure.  then we got to talking about me and him in the car together.  i get upset alot when mike is in the car with me because he tends to criticize the way i drive.  i know i'm not the best driver in the world...but it has gotten to the point that i get so nervous when he is in the car with me that i do stupid things and then he just criticizes me even more.  i just wish he wouldn't be so critical of the little things that i do differently than he does.  i just always feel so stupid when i am in the car with him, i feel like he is my driving instructor or something.  anyway...we got into a big argument about it and we were outside. we haven't argued in a long time and we actually got pretty loud. we were outside until his mom came out and told us to quiet down and come inside.  so we did and we tried to talk things out, but we really weren't getting very far.  mrs.z was sitting there trying to help us. i'll admit it, she was taking my side pretty much because she knows the way mike can be sometimes, especially when it comes to driving.  mike get so angry really fast though, so sometimes it is hard to just sit and talk with him about things like this.  he does recognize that he sometimes has a problem with anger management though and he wants to get better.  after about 2.5 hours of talking, we finally worked things out and came to an understanding of what each of us was saying.  it ended on a good note.  i really hate when we argue, and i admit that sometimes it is over really, really petty and stupid things, yet i think this was something that needed to be talked about and i am glad that we finally were able to talk about it even though we had to yell at eachother first. 
like i said, i really don't like when we argue sometimes, but we are always able to talk about it and that is really important.  we have been through a lot of stuff after the past 2 years, especially with me being at college and us being away from each other for months at a time.  i think it only makes us stronger.  there are a lot of people out there who would probably brag because they're in a relationship where they never argue, but i am glad that mike and i do argue from time to time.  it makes us stronger and it makes us better at dealing with the things that are destined to come up sometime in the future.  the fact that mike and i can argue, talk something out, and make it better, just makes me think that what we have is something really, really awesome.  anyway, things are better now and after driving to the shore with mike sitting next to me and not hearing one critical remark makes me feel even better.

so yeah, susie was here and we had a good time. our room is going to be so awesome this year.  we were making all these plans and thinking about our schedules and stuff.  all the talk about school really made me want to go back.  its not that i don't like hanging out with all my friends here (you guys rock!), but i am just ready to do the whole college thing again for awhile (well...except for the whole class thing) i think i am juist ready for school again.  yet, there are plenty more good times to be had here at home and i am planning on taking full advantage of them.  school will be here before i know it.

so as far as today...i went to work (i had to stay a little late to play catch up since i took monday off to hang out with susie)...then i came home and talked to mike for a few mintues...then my sister came over so i was hanging out with her...we ate dinner...and now i am here (dinner + talking to the fam took quite some time).  i think i might hit the sack early tonight so i actually feel rested tomorrow. well...hopefully i'll remember to keep writing in this thinger.  leter dudes!!

wow...i haven't written in this thing since april...i figured i'd drop a line.  not much is going on...if you want to know what all has gone on in the past few weeks since i have been home, just read beth's journal.  we've had some good times.  i've pretty much been doing everything that she has...we've just been hanging around a lot with the gang.  if i am not with beth, kelly, etc...than i am usually with mike.  well...minus the hours between 9 and 3 that i spend at work coding bills and putting them in the computer (ooo thrilling).  the summer has been rockin' so far though.  the fez is this friday!!!!!! and i just got tickets to go see weezer and dashboard confessional at the end of july!!!!!!!! like i said though, if you really want to know the details of my social life, just read beth's entry...we pretty much have done the same things...well...except i didn't go to see her crotchety grandmother :).  so i'll write about something that wasn't already talked about.

things with mike and i have been a little hectic lately.  i don't know if hectic is the right word, but thats the best i could do for right now.  we seem to be getting in stupid arguments all of a sudden.  i came to the conclusion though that we are both just frustrated.  i am frustrated because i missed him so much while i was away at school, and now that i am home, i just want to be with him, but i can't because he has to go to school ecvery day.  he is frustrated because he just doesn't want to be in school anymore.  its just frustrating for both of us because we want things that just can't happen right now because of our schedules.  i mean, things aren't horrible or anything.  we see eachother a lot and for the most part, things are awesome, we have just been getting more testy than usual the past few weeks.  but he only has a week and a half before graduation so things are going to be better.

i guess thats not the whole story though.  i get frustrated a lot about his job.  i work a simple 9-3 weekday job and he doesn't, which makes it kind of hard to plan things.  its not that i can't deal with that though, its not the working in retail part that really bothers me...its the place that he works that bothers me.  He has been working at aero for over a year and half now and he is treated like crap.  he is pretty much a manager, but he only gets paid 8.25 an hour, while some other girl who is just a regular clerk person makes 10...why you ask?...just because the main manager likes her more.  half the time, he gets called in when he is not supposed to be working, he gets scheduled to work when he requested off, he doesn't get more than a 15 minute break for a long shift...and he is usually there for at least an hour and a half after the store closes.  it just makes me mad because he works hard and all he gets is crap.  i went to see him last night at work and instead of his usual 30 min break, he only got 15. he was already tired and  he hadn't eaten anything all day.  he was angry because of work and i could tell that he was way stressed out.  he told me he would give me a call when he got home.  i heard from him at 9:15...over 2 hours after the mall closes on sunday.  i'm sorry, but there is no reason for him to have to stay that long.  he has finals coming up this week and he is not sleeping or eating right, and he has about double the amount of stress that he should have.  i'm just really worried about him.  i just hate the way work makes him.  it stresses him out so much and he doesn't need that crap.  i am just worried that he is going to get sick or something.  like i said, aero just sucks...they always screw him over and i hate what it does to him.  he told me about a month ago that he was tired of it too and he was going to try to find a new job...but then he didn't say anything about it.  he kept working and putting up with all kinds of crap.  now he finally seems to be looking for a new job.  i don't care if he gets another job in retail, i just want it to be somewhere that he doesn't get screwed over all the time and doesn't cause him so much stress.  i am just really worried about him right now. 

anyway, enough about that.  today was a usual boring day at work...of course its $10 an hour so i'm not complaining.  other than that, nothing is going on...but THE FEZ IS THIS WEEKEND!!!!!!!! woohoo..i can't wait!!! just as long as i don't have to deal with tim and andy acting like complete idiots and smoking up...if they do...they can find their own way home because i don't want to deal with it.  well...i think i am going to go to the awards thingy tonight for mike... but i have no details so perhaps i should give hime a call.  later kids!

I really only have about 5 minutes to write at this current time, but i thought i would post something really quick.  So things sort of suck right now.  Susie, Colleen, and i found out yesterday that we didn't get the triple we wanted next year so we didn't really know what to do.  we had to apply early, but by now pretty much every one has decided who they are living with even though the lottery isn't until next week.  So colleen spent that night searching for anyone reasonable who doesn't have a roommate.  Finally she talked to one of her current roommates friends and they decided that they are going to live together next year.  It was good that we worked it out, but yet it sucks like a mother fo that the three of us aren't going to be able to live together next year.  So anyway, susie and i are going to live together and colleen is going to live with this girl shannon.

Other than that, i just have a out a billion things to do in the next few (but final) weeks of school.  I have 2 major papers, 1 project, and 2 presentations.  plus i am working on a literary magazine and planning a seminar that is next weekend.  I have had no time for anything but doing work.  oh and...i got a 48 on my last calc test, luckily she drops our lowest grade.  I feel like i have been doing work forever and it sucks.  I don't get to talk to anyone anymore.  I just keep telling myself that i just have 4 more weeks.

But....my boy mikey is coming this saturday to see me!!!!!  I have been working way hard this week so that i can get things done before tomorrow.  He has bene planning top come for a long time and it is the only thing i have to look forward to until the end of the year so there is no way i was going to let school get in the way of that.  I worked my ass off this week and tomorrow is going to be my mikey break.

anyway, i have to go see mrs,harrison for help with my calc lab...blah...and then i have to go to the library...so i'll catch y'all later.  i miss you guys.  see you in a few weeks!!!

I realize that i have not written in quite some time. The truth is, i have been extremely busy.  I feel like i never get a chance to relax and when i do, i want to do just that...relax.  I have meetings all the time because now that we are coming up on the end of the year (woohoo!!!!), we need to get things done.  It kind of sucks, but i guess its better than being bored.  Anyway, other than being busy, things are going alright.  I have come to the comclusion that Mike doesn't know how to mail letters...or else his mailman hates him.  Only about half of the stuff he sends me actaully gets here.  His mom sent me a card yesterday and it got here today, he sent one 2 days ago and it hasn't gotten here.  if it doesn't get here within 2 days, than it won't come.  Seriously, only half of the things he has sent me actually get here...it just sucks because i always get disappointed.

Anyway, nothing else is really going on. last night colleen and i really wanted donuts so we made susie take us to dunkin donuts.  it was yummy...but i didn't go to bed until 1.  I have to go see mrs. harrison this afternoon because our lab makes NO sense. I am totally lost about it...and i hate calc.  Thats about it..perhaps i will write more later, but right now i have to get some stuff done.  talk to you folks later!

If there is one thing that I will share with my kids when I have a family, it's that life never works out the way you plan.  You can try as hard as you want to make things work out the way you want, but they rarely ever do.  Instead you are left feeling shitty and crappy and like you have let down the best friends you have ever had.  You cry for awhile and think that you'll never get over it, but then you realize that crying does you no good because it can't fix or change any of the decisions you've made.  So you stop crying and if you are like me, you write about it...well, at least you write about how you feel.  I'm not saying that life sucks, I'm just saying that sometimes being optimistic doesn't pay off.  I wish life was easier, but it's not.  I'm just glad I have people around to help me make it through.

I know I haven't written in quite awhile, but I have been extremely busy.  Last week I felt like I was always working.  I felt like I got a lot accomplished though so I guess that's good.  I also had like a gazillion meetings last week for different clubs and stuff.  Yeah....I had a calc test too...and I lab to do which took about two million years to do.  That's right...two million years.  Anyway, things are going alright here I guess.  I got a letter the other day telling me that I made Dean's list this semester and I found out that I am in the top ten percent of my class.  So that made me feel good.  You can call me a nerd if you want, but I don't care.  My parents are paying lots of money for me to be here I think the least I could do is do my best.  Not to mention the fact that I want to do something with my life and be successful.  I guess that fact that my roommate is a total waste of space makes me want to work a little harder.  She makes me realize how stupid it is to sit on your ass and not to anything and watch your life waste away.  There is no way in hell I want to be anything like that.  Plus, like I said, I want to be something.  Anyway, I have a good Lesley story to share.
     
Okay, so Lesley has kind of been seeing this kid jeff.  She randomly leaves late at night to "go for a walk" with him.  She has been hanging out with him a lot lately.  This is the same kid that I found laying on our couch inder MY blanket the day I came back from Penn State with Mike.  Well..then she decided that she didn't want a relationship with him because she would rather have sex with her ex-boyfriend Darren.  After she told Jeff this, she kept hanging out with him all the time anyway.  Well...eventually they mnade out and became a couple.  Well...she didn't even tell us they were a "couple" until they she broke up with him 5 days later.  Then last night she went to talk to him...and she ened up going to his frat and getting totally trashed.  When I woke up this morning she was not in our room.  I woke up my computer to find a message from jeff telling me that lesley was really messed up and she was spending the night with him.  See...but here is the kicker...Jeff's frat house is literally like right across the parking lot from our building.  Jeff is only a sophomore so he doesn't live in the house, he lives basically across campus.  If Lesley was so drunk, why didn't she just have jeff walk her back to our building?  What I am trying to say is...Lesley is a drunken whore.  Oh...and here is the other funny thing.  We went to friendly's last night and there was this group of like white trash townies at the table behind us.  They were being really obnoxious.  If I was the waitress I would have told them to get out.  But anyway, we were making comments about them being white trash and talking about how one of the frats was having a "white trash mixer" last night where you had to come dressed as white trash.  So when Lesley was getting dressed for the party she was going to, she put on this really tight, ugly, whore shirt and told us that she "wanted to stay with the whole white trash theme".  So pretty much she told us that she looked like white trash..and she wasn't even going to the mixer.  Man...she is such a loser.  

Other than that, I don't really have any good stories.  I have just been really busy with class and stuff this past week.  I am on the planning commitee for the sleeping bag seminar that we are holding here in april and I am also on the staff for a new literary magazine that we are starting this year. It should be fun.  Plus I am working with the rest of the english club officers to put together our valentine's day fundraiser.  We are making poetry grams that people can send through campus mail to their friends and significant others and stuff.  Hopefully we'll make a decent amount of money.  Also, despite the fact that I can't meet with my study buddy this semester, I am still involved in the program so I have to go do different stores in the area and try to get donations for door prizes for the study buddy spaghetti dinner.  It should be a good time..the spaghetti dinner that is.  Yeah so between all this and getting my work done, I am pretty busy. It's good though.  I would rather have a lot of stuff to do than sit on my ass all day.  Plus, being busy makes the time go faster.  

Yeah...so anyone who is curious about my Nancy Drew quotes, I got this really awesome book 2 weeks ago called "Nancy Drew's Guide to Life".  It is so funny.  It has all these quotes from Nancy Drew books...they are just so funny.  My brother was said that he reads them every day and thinks they are hysterical.  He wants to see the book...so does my mom since she grew up on Nancy Drew.  She thinks it sounds funny.  My mom is weird sometimes.  Every time I call her, she talks for SOOOO long.  I mean, it's not that I don't like talking to my mom, its just that she talks FOREVER!!!  I guess I shouldn't be complaining though because I do miss my parents in some weird way.  Sometimes I wish I was closer to my mom, but I'm just not.  I look at Mike and how close he is to his mom and how he talks to her about almost everything.  Sometimes I wish I had that, but my mom isn't really that kind of person. I just don't feel comfortable talking to my mom about a lot of stuff.  I guess maybe the fact that my mom had four kids makes it hard to get really close to all of us.  And then there is my dad.  My relationship with my dad is just really weird.  Sometimes I really hate him for the way he acts, but then sometimes he is really cool.  Like sometimes he will scream at me for spilling a glass of milk at the dinner table and then other times I will come down for breakfast on the weekends and he will give me a big hug.  Mrs. Z said something one time about me being my dad's favorite.  I thought about it and I didn't really know what to think.  I mean, sometimes I think that maybe I am, but sometimes I don't.  I am the only one of my siblings who has a nickname.  My dad has been calling me peaches since I was a baby and he still does.  Not all the time, but pretty regularly.  It's weird.  Sometimes I think my dad talks to me more than he does to everyone else.  But I really don't know.  My dad is just weird.  He called the other day and was talking to me about Lesley.  It was odd.
